name: Hampton Inn San Diego/Del Mar

reviews.text: This is a great place for a quick getaway for a small family on a budget. The rooms are clean and well appointed if a bit on the small side. I didn't care much for the 2 full-size beds in the standard double. I was under the impression that most hotels have queen-size as standard. Would have liked to have a mini-fridge in the room. The full breakfast is excellent and just what one needs to get started. Coffee was great in the morning but cold in the afternoon and evening. The parking is underneath and locked up at night which is a plus. Good restaurants located near the hotel and Torrey Pines beach is just a short drive away. All in all a great value, especially if you find a discounted rate as we did.
reviews.title: Great Value for a Quick Getaway
Good location, room could use sheer curtains
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for business and it was fine. It's in a good location near the freeway with restaurants and shopping up the street. The staff were courteous, the breakfast was fine. There were no surprises and I slept well here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only recommendation I'd make is to add sheer curtains. My window looked directly down into the Taco Bell drive-through and to the freeway. When traffic was slow, it was disconcerting to make eye contact with people driving by.
reviews.title: Very quiet, but details not as nice as other Hampton Inns

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here while visiting the Del Mar Fairgrounds. My wife liked it a lot, but I had some hesitations. The room did not have a mini-refrigerator which I thought all Hampton Inns had. If you are expecting a mini-frig, be sure and request it when making your reservations. The furniture and room colors were drab and boring, and could use upgrading or wall paper. The beds were very good. The flat screen t.v. was nice, but no HD channels, and in fact, only about a dozen channels. Could use Discovery and Fox Sports San Diego. The breakfast room downstairs is very big with a good breakfast, (although I would have liked some donuts or something sweet!). I thought the towels were very thin, and could use upgrading. There were no flyers/brochures of local attractions like all hotels have now days. I thought the Hampton Inn-Kearney Mesa was better. But, this hotel was VERY QUIET, considering all the people staying there during the fair! That was a major plus.
reviews.title: Good for sleeping over.

reviews.text: This hotel is clean, quiet and it does its job: a good room to sleep.
reviews.title: Safe and clean

reviews.text: Hampton Inn boasts a stellar, overall reputation from personal and professional experience so this was a natural choice for a stay in North County San Diego. However, this Del Mar location was merely average, not a notch above the rest.
reviews.title: Average for a Hampton Inn

reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: OK for one or two nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the close proximity to I-5, the room was surprisingly quiet with double-paned windows - absolutely no noise. It's very close to Sorrento Valley, La Jolla, and a quick hop to Downtown San Diego so the commute is little to none. Surrounding amenities are excellent: Von's grocery store, multiple restaurants (Mexican, Thai, American Contemporary, Sushi, BBQ, and fast food) and gas stations. It is seven (7) minutes to Torrey Pines State Reserve and Beach which is an excellent option for fitness enthusiasts and those just looking to soak up the North County San Diego Beach scene for even just a short while.
reviews.title: Great sleep, great location, great free hot breakfast, free wi fi and parking!!

reviews.text: The breakfast spread was excellent with even more healthy options to boot: oatmeal, skim milk, cereal, and very fresh fruit (apples and bananas). The breakfast area was spacious, clean, and well attended to.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: They have made a conscientious effort in the area of security. The front is locked down after 10 pm and the underground parking provides vehicle peace of mind. Small steps, but preventative ones.
reviews.title: Average Hotel. Room hardware needs an upgrade

reviews.text: We stayed here overnight during the Christmas holidays. Very convenient to the freeways, but there's noise from the passing cars. Ask for a room away from the traffic. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. All in all, a fine place for the short term. Rooms were basic but clean. Adequate free parking and a gas station next door.
reviews.title: Great For the Short Term

reviews.text: Perfectly fine value for the money, but don't expect to go anywhere except by car. Torrey pines Beach and the Del Mar beaches are close, but the hotel itself sits in a crotch of freeway access and gas station/fast food/office complexes. And they really shouldn't be able to call that a pool. After we moved here(we stayed here while waiting for a house to close) I have driven by that pool so many times(I gas up next door) and have never once seen it being used. But as I said before, if you have to stay in Carmel Valley, it's a decent choice. If you have to stay in Carmel Valley and are on an expense account you'd probably opt for the Marriot or Doubletree.
reviews.title: fine if you are here on business
Great start to our holiday
reviews.text: My husband, two teenage children and I stayed in a suite in this hotel for 4 nights in September 2005. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel has good access to I5 but is not noisy. The suites are very comfortable with two bathrooms, a king bed in the main bedroom, and a sofa sleeper (plus rollaway) in the other room plus microwave and fridge. Breakfast was very good (fruit salad, bagels, some cooked items, etc). Free internet access worked fine. The gym was small and gets a bit crowded in the morning. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only minor downside was the pool, which was on the small side and near the main entrance to the hotel.

reviews.title: Friendly staff, and overall great place to stay
reviews.text: Just got back from four nights/five days in sunny San Diego. After doing a ton of research on this website, I settled on the Hampton Inn/Del Mar.

And I wasn't disappointed. It's darn near perfect if you're going to the races or anything at the fairgrounds. The rooms are not fancy by any means, but they're clean and have everything you need including free wi-fi. One nice feature of Hampton inns is that if you forget something like toothpaste, they'll bring some up to your room.
reviews.title: Great hotel for bringing dogs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night, from 12-13 September 2010. The facilities were comfortable, functional and no frills. Everything in my room was clean and in good condition, and the bed was very comfortable. My only grouse about the room is the absence of a valuables safe.
reviews.title: Great service, but geared more to business than leisure travellers
Everything is perfect
reviews.text: The location, at the intersection of two freeways, is probably ideal if you're on business in San Diego or the surrounding area (20 minutes' drive to downtown SD and within easy reach of surrounding towns, e.g. Carlsbad), but leisure travellers should probably bear in mind that it's not within walking distance of any tourist attractions. The dining room in the hotel only does breakfast: for dinner you'll need to go somewhere else. There is a strip mall with a number of restaurants about 15 minutes' walk away (the walk looked to me to be perfectly safe after dark), and there is also a restaurant and bar in the Marriott just across the street, though the restaurant is closed on Sundays. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room rate was OK for what it was: neither a ripoff nor a bargain.

It is an excellent hotel. The room is nice, clean and comfortable to stay. We arrived in the afternoon from Los Angeles. We took a nap after check in and went to old town and the next day San Diego zoo. The location is convenient. There is AMPM next door. It is near the hwy but it is so quiet with window closed, while you can also open the window to have fresh air. Windows in some hotels cannot be opened. It is not ocean view but it is mountain view. I like it! The TV and internet are good too. You need to check the little booklet in the drawer for the attraction info. We got coupons from there for San Diego zoo with $10 discount. The breakfast is so good, yummy and so many choices. You can even make fresh waffle by yourself!
reviews.title: Was Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had drove in from LAX taking the Pacific Coast Highway. That was the most Beautiful Ride ever! If you got the time you gotta try it out. We were tired and really looking forward to relaxing in our rooms. The Front Desk people were very friendly and offered suggestions on where to eat or where to go for Happy Hour. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds were like sleeping on clouds! The rooms are spacious. The Breakfast offered on Saturday was awesome. They offered a selection of breads and muffins, a selection of cereals, a selection of fruits, and you could make your own waffles. As for what happened on Sunday I don't know.....but stay away from that turkey sausage! We went out to a great restaurant and bar suggested by the front desk in Del Mar called En Fuego's for dinner. The restaurant area looks over in to the Bar Area.
reviews.title: So Nice

reviews.text: A Great Place! We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn for a reasonable price. Would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Clean & Quiet
Great Hotel!!
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Hampton Inn Del Mar!

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: The staff was excellent and granted every request within moments! The room, lobby and breakfast room are decorated with sturdy but modern & lovely furniture, very elegant! Rooms are spotlessly clean. The televisions in the rooms are good sized and two big screen TVs are in the breakfast room. The free continental breakfast is above and beyond just "continental." The parking is included and in a secure underground parking area. A great value for the money and the Del Mar area!

reviews.title: Great Value in San Diego
reviews.text: We WILL be staying here again!

reviews.title: Not your average off-ramp hotel.
reviews.text: I stayed here one night on my way down to San Diego, after taking reviews from TripAdvisor. The hotel is right off the I5, next to a gas station and the hilton. Free Parking, friendly staff, nice atmosphere, good size room, free Internet, good continental breakfast, good size beds and TV. Recommended and I would stay there again. Very fair room price.

reviews.title: Best hotel in Del Mar
reviews.text: I like to get down to San Diego on a regular basis so I prefer not to always shell out major bucks for my accomodations. This Hampton Inn near Del Mar really fits the bill. It's a lot nicer that you would expect to get for a $110 particluarly in this area of town.
The staff was quite nice but this is a not a great hotel for business travelers.
reviews.title: Poor hotel for business travelers

reviews.text: It's really just about the rooms. There are only a few power outlets in the room in hard to access places. There is no wireless internet. There isn't actually a desk either - its just a square table pushed against the wall.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Del Mar
Comfortable stay at a budget
reviews.text: This is a fairly typical Hampton Inn located right next to the I-5 and a short drive to La Jolla and the beaches of Del Mar. Could not hear the traffic noise inside the rooms, although you could hear some noise from the room next door, overall fairly quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The king suite is quite large, with a big bedroom and a separate room with a sleeper sofa, one and half baths, small refrigerator and a microwave - very convienent for families. There are only a few of these rooms on each floor. The king bed was very comfortable, the sofabed was OK. Rooms and the hotel in general were very clean.
reviews.title: Could have been 5 stars..... except....
Basic but VERY COMFORTABLE
reviews.text: Breakfast was standard Hampton Inn with a variety of cold food, two hot dishes and a waffle maker. The room was fairly large and the staff kept the food items well stocked.

The positives = The bathrooms were nice, new, clean and had shampoo, condtioner etc.. The room was clean, Big TV with movies. Breakfast is included. Free parking. The whole hotel is sparkling, and well decorated.
reviews.title: Clean, small room off the highway

reviews.text: The less then positive = The hotel is literally right off the highway and our room was facing that direction. We didn't hear any noise but the view wasn't "relaxing". We were travelling with 3 kids. A single room is too small for a family of 5. We did it and we still can't figure out why. Make sure you get 2 rooms wth a family this size.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was good but not as good as the Marriott Residence Inn's breakfast. (Hampton Inn is lacking a waffle maker and homemade oatmeal cereal)
reviews.title: Very Good Choice
Great hotel
reviews.text: A great hotel.........reasonably priced, very clean, great breakfast, and the staff was very helpful and professional. We were very pleased with our stay.

reviews.title: a wonderful stay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Del Mar for several nights in June 2005. Our standard double room was clean and up-to-date, very nice bathroom. Not the largest room in the world, but adequate. The daily free breakfast is excellent with lots of choices. The desk staff were cheery and very helpful, giving us a free map showing restaurants etc. close to the hotel. It is close to I-5 which makes it convenient for getting into town. Five-minute drive from Torrey Pines state beach & reserve. We are glad we chose this hotel, thank you TripAdvisor!

aka: Hampton Inn San Diego/Del Mar Hotel San Diego
